title.rendered: What Is The Best Nikon Lens for Real Estate Photography?

content.rendered:
Table Of Contents

  • 1 10 Best Nikon Lens for Real Estate Photography
    • 1.1 1. Nikon AF FX NIKKOR 50mm F/1.4D DSLR Lens with Autofocus
    • 1.2 2. Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G Lens
    • 1.3 3. Sigma 10-20mm f/3.5 Aspherical Super Wide Angle Lens
    • 1.4 4. Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G ED
    • 1.5 5. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 16-35mm f/4G ED
    • 1.6 6. Tamron AFA012N700 SP 15-30mm f/2.8 Di VC USD
    • 1.7 7. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED Zoom Lens
    • 1.8 8. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 20mm f/1.8G ED
    • 1.9 9. Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 10-24mm f/3.5-4.5G ED
    • 1.10 10. Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 14-24mm f/2.8G ED
  • 2 What to Look Before Buying a Nikon Lense for Real Estate Photography
    • 2.1 Focal Length
    • 2.2 Construction
    • 2.3 Auto Focus
    • 2.4 Low Light Performance
    • 2.5 What Would Be The Best Real Estate Photography Lens For The Nikon FX Cameras?
    • 2.6 What Type Of Lens Is Used For Real Estate Photography?
    • 2.7 Is A 24mm Nikon Lens Good For Real Estate?
    • 2.8 What focal length is best for real estate?
    • 2.9 Is 50mm Good For Real Estate?
    • 2.10 What Filter Does Real Estate Photographers Use?
  • 3 Conclusion
    • 3.1 Bordie Capron

The best Nikon lens for real estate photography can offer your professional result right away. We have tested out top Nikon lenses and got the sharpest images. Many photographers have used these lenses and it was a lot helpful for them. Below we will go onto the best real estate Nikon lenses at once.

As you are getting spot-on results, having the best lens becomes way more crucial. It helps you to improve your real estate photography and offer better services. Thus, make sure you check out the lenses to get sharper and detailed photographs.

Our 3 Top Picks

Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm

Check Price

Sigma 10-20mm f/3.5

Check Price

Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm 

Check Price

10 Best Nikon Lens for Real Estate Photography

Let’s explore some of the best Nikon lenses for real estate photography. These lenses solve your issues regarding property photographs. With proper and visible shoots, the real estate would be great looking and attractive in your images. Whether you are doing it as a hobby or profession, it would be worth the effort.

1. Nikon AF FX NIKKOR 50mm F/1.4D DSLR Lens with Autofocus

Check Updated Price On Amazon

If you are interested in getting the best real estate photos, the following lens would be a gem. It’s the Nikon AF FX NIKKOR 50mm F/1.4D DSLR lens. The lens has features that provide you with great real estate photographs right away.

For example, the lens captures stunning real estate buildings in lower lights. Because it’s the best Nikon lens for low light photos. As a real estate photographer, it would help you a lot in taking exterior photos. 

When it comes to the compatibility of the lens, it has great range. The lens works great for both Nikon DX and FX DSLR. Thus, your property photographs would be seamless. 

Thanks to the aperture f/1.8, the lens lets you place the real estate property in focus. Moreover, you could capture images in a shallow depth of field. Which is a great feature to have for photographing the entire property.

Pros
  • Secure lens construction

  • Offers shallow depth of field

  • Has dust protective lens cap

  • Exceptional low light performance

  • Sharper image capturing

Cons
  • No built-in VR

2. Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G Lens

Check Updated Price On Amazon

Want to take real estate photos with large areas? The Nikon AF-S Nikkor 50mm f/1.8G Lens can give you exceptional results. It features edge-to-edge sharpness to give you even sharpness all around the images.

Along with that, the lens offers you seamless autofocus on every photo. As a professional photographer, it would make your task a lot easier. 

Perhaps, the lens works great both in landscape and portrait mode photographs. Thus, you get a proper shoot regardless of the photography mood. 

The lens shape is compact to carry along while traveling. As you may need to travel from one real estate site to another. The weight of the lens item is a lot less, making it great to add to your Nikon camera and keep shooting photos.

All in one, it’s a great Nikon lens to have as a real estate photographer in the bag-pack.

Pros
  • Silent wave motors

  • Best for capturing large real estate area

  • Smoother Autofocus

  • Nikon DX and FX DSLR compatible

  • Edge-to-Edge sharpness

Cons
  • Not a zoomable lens

3. Sigma 10-20mm f/3.5 Aspherical Super Wide Angle Lens

Check Updated Price On Amazon

The Nikon lens we are talking about is Sigma 10-20mm f/3.5 EX DC HSM. If you are looking for a great Nikon wide-angle lens for real estate photography, then the following lens would be the answer.

The lens zoomable features make it a masterpiece to take exterior and interior with ease. As a result, your architectural photos would be unique and well-composed. No doubt it’s one of the best lenses for interior design photography projects.

When talking about giving perspective to your real estate photos, the lens does a great job at it. For example, the lens is great at landscape mode photos. 

To avoid any sort of glare or flare, the lens has a multilayer coating covering it up. Thus, the image would be free of distortion even when taking real estate at dusk. 

In short, the following lens is compatible with most of the Nikon DSLR cameras and gives you great photos. Plus, it feels lightweight on hand to take photos on the go.

Pros
  • Ultra-Wide Zoom Lens

  • Avoids front lens rotations

  • Unique landscape perspective

  • Multilayer coating

  • Quieter operation

Cons
  • Autofocus needs a bit of adjustment

4. Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G ED

Check Updated Price On Amazon

Whether you are shooting the exterior or interior of real estate, the following lens can impress you a lot. It’s the Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G ED. It has features to be a great real estate Nikon lens. 

Unlike any other lenses, the following lens provides you with great autofocus. Thus, you could place your real estate property in focus without any hassle. 

The maximum aperture of the lens is F1.8 and it makes the lens great for shooting real estate even on gloomy days. we use these lenses for sports photography as well, and the result was amazing.

The focal length of the lens is 35mm and it’s enough to let you capture surreal images.

In case you want to shoot indoor photos, the following lens would be the best. Thus, the following kit is one of the best lenses for interior design photography as well.

As additional equipment, you get a lens cap to avoid dirt from entering into the lens surface.

Pros
  • Has proper user manual

  • Compatible with all Nikon DSLR

  • Compact design

  • Stable performance

  • Offers great low light images

Cons
  • A bit expensive lens kit

5. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 16-35mm f/4G ED

Check Updated Price On Amazon

Loves to take real estate photos with bare hands? The following lens would give you the best VR stabilization. It’s the Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 16-35mm f/4G ED lens. And it eliminates all the hand vibration effects you get as a real estate photographer. 

The plus point is it’s a wide-angle lens that lets you cover a wide area at once. It makes it perfect for taking real estate sites with a big area. 

You could take a shot of the entire landscape of a city. The sharpness of the image stays on point even when you shoot landscapes that are to the features of the lens.

If you are a fan of low-light images, the lens has exceptional capabilities to take crisp and clear real estate photography. So, your exterior shoots would be great regardless of lighting. 

Have a check on the lens for your professional projects.

Pros
  • Has vibration reduction feature

  • Nikon FX mounting

  • Sharper focusing

  • Two different focusing modes

  • Even brightness

Cons
  • Adjusting the focal length is a bit tricky

6. Tamron AFA012N700 SP 15-30mm f/2.8 Di VC USD

Check Updated Price On Amazon

The following lens is one of the great Nikon wide-angle lenses for real estate photography projects. It’s a great lens to level up your photographs from the first click.

The lens is great for wide architectural photographs as it’s a wide-angle lens. You could capture dynamic shots of different types of real estate right away.

Focusing on the lens is decent and gives you accurate results without extra effort. Thus, your subject would be a lot clearer and more visible on the images.

Another exceptional feature of the lens is fluorine coating. It fights off dirt elements from the lens and makes it easier for you to clean it away. As a result, you could shoot photos for long hours outdoors.

Thus, you could try out the following lens to get super sharp images for your real estate photography clients.

Pros
  • Has Vibration Compensation

  • The zoom range of 15-30

  • Fluorine coating on the lens

  • Lower noise

  • Efficient background blur

Cons
  • A bit heavy lens

7. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G ED Zoom Lens

Check Updated Price On Amazon

If you are looking for an 18mm prime lens Nikon kit, check out the following one. Right now, we are talking about the Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 18-35mm f/3.5-4.5G. It’s a robust Nikon lens suitable for pro-level real estate photographs. 

According to most of its users, it works great like any other prime lenses you get on the market. The prime lens lets you create effects where your subjects appear more vibrant than the background.

Talking about sharpness, it provides you with great sharpness in all areas of your image. As a result, the building details would be a lot clearer than any ordinary Nikon lenses. 

Whether you are in real estate or landscape photography, you won’t face any kind of blurriness on the lens. The extra-low dispersion (ED) and Aspherical (AS) glass build let you avoid any other lighting errors.

At last, we all agree, It’s a great companion for real estate image shooting projects.

Pros
  • FX-format lens

  • Multipurpose lens kit

  • Provides great sharpness

  • Smooth focusing ring

  • Premium built quality

Cons
  • Images are sharper than usual

8. Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 20mm f/1.8G ED

Check Updated Price On Amazon

The Nikon AF-S FX NIKKOR 20mm f/1.8G ED is a great kit to get consistent performance regardless of the situation. If you are a photographer taking Architecture, interior, long-range shots, having such a lens is a must.

On the following kit, you have a 7.8-inch close focus capability, which lets you work with close objects. It lets you maintain accurate focal points from close-range shoots.

Sizing of the lens is compact making it perfect to carry with you anywhere you want. Plus, the lens pack comes with a pouch to let you carry the lens with you.

The Nano Crystal Coat of the lens protects the lens from any rendering issue. Thus, you get a clear image in both real estate interior and exterior images.

F/18 maximum aperture lens is great to have as a real estate photographer. So check the lens out now.

Pros
  • Ultra-wide lens features

  • Best performance in low light

  • Easy to carry with

  • Great for landscape photography

  • Versatile at taking close shoots

Cons
  • Lower detail on night sky

9. Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 10-24mm f/3.5-4.5G ED

Check Updated Price On Amazon

The mentioned lens kit is the Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 10-24mm f/3.5-4.5G ED. It’s one of the great lenses to shoot architectural or landscape photos. 

Focal length 10- 24 mm of the lens is perfect to let you capture a wide area of real estate. It makes sure the whole property area would be visible in your image composition.

As a real estate photographer, you would feel a lot comfortable working with the lens. For example, autofocusing of the lens is smooth and silent. It works great for most occasions. 

Shooting from tricky angles is safe on the lens, thanks to its Aspherical lens elements. Thus, your images would be free of light error and noises all the time.

Pros
  • Sharp photo rendering

  • Free of lens chromatic aberrations

  • Best for the architectural shoot

  • Perfect focal length

  • Color Corrections

Cons
  • Not for budget photographers

10. Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 14-24mm f/2.8G ED

Check Updated Price On Amazon

Do you need a robust lens for your professional shooting projects? Put your hands onto the following lens unit. It’s known as Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 14-24mm f/2.8G ED. 

The lens has no doubt one of the secure constructions of all lense. It has 2 ED glass elements and 3 aspherical lenses for spot-on image capturing.

Moreover, nano-coating makes the lens resistant to dirt and similar elements.

The lens features a focal length range of 14 -24 millimeters which is ideal for shooting real estate images.

 Plus, the closest focus distance of the lens is 0.9 feet. And it would let you capture property and interior from a lot of close range. No option to get blurriness at all.

It’s one of the great Nikon lenses with the sharpest photos as well. Don’t miss out on the unit as it provides you instantly. exceptional images.

Pros
  • Sharp images

  • Close range images

  • Solid construction

  • Consistent performance

Cons
  • Heavy to carry

What to Look Before Buying a Nikon Lense for Real Estate Photography

Let’s learn about the aspects you should review while buying the best real estate photography lens. It would be a lot helpful to choose the ideal lens kit a lot faster.

Focal Length

The focal length of the lens determines what your photographs would look like. And it’s a lot vital for any real estate photographer to choose the lens with the right focal length.

In general, the best focal length for real estate photography would be from 16mm to 24mm. This is why make sure your Nikon lens supports the following focal length as well. 

Construction

Do you have to shoot property images in rough condition? In such cases, you need a lens with robust construction. Lenses like Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 14-24mm f/2.8G ED are a great example of a dust-proof build.

To be specific, check if your lens has either nano-coating, ED glass, or Aspherical lens elements. Having one of these would improve the lens’s lifespan.

Auto Focus

While shooting images on the go, autofocus can help you out. A lens with a proper auto-focusing feature would let you focus on objects a lot faster.  Thus, you don’t have to alter focusing settings manually.

However, not every lens has the best auto-focus features. Few of the lenses might need a little bit of adjustment from you to make the focus accurate. So, check If your Nikon lens has autofocus or not before dividing on a Nikon lens.

Low Light Performance

In many instances, you may have to take real estate photos at dusk. This is why low light performance becomes crucial for you as a photographer. On top of that, low-light image capturing is helpful in interior photography.

Above we have mentioned some of the best Nikon lenses for low light photographs. Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G ED is a great example to start with.

Let’s go on to find out some of the frequently asked questions for real estate photography Nikon lenses.

What Would Be The Best Real Estate Photography Lens For The Nikon FX Cameras?

If you are looking for lenses for Nikon FX DSLR cameras, we have listed some of the best lenses. In general, Nikon AF FX NIKKOR 50mm F/1.4D DSLR Lens would be one of the ideal options. It has all the features and compatibility for Nikon FX cameras as well.

What Type Of Lens Is Used For Real Estate Photography?

To be specific, lenses that have at least 16 to 24 mm focal length, F/1.8 aperture are used for real estate photography. Moreover, the lens must have proper protection against dirt and water. Plus, the lenses should offer sharper images as well.

Is A 24mm Nikon Lens Good For Real Estate?

The 24mm Nikon lens would be great for most real estate photography projects. The focal length would let you capture interesting real estate without any issue. You could use the lens for cityscape photographs as well. 

What focal length is best for real estate?

Most of the time, focal length such as 16-35mm is the best for real estate photography. Most real estate photographers would like to photograph the aperture of F4 as well. If you are working on real estate, make sure to finetune to focal length as well. 

Is 50mm Good For Real Estate?

In short, it’s not a good option to go above the 50mm mark. This is why while doing photography, keep trying to shoot photos around 35mm. It would provide you with better images that attract a higher number of real estate property buyers.

What Filter Does Real Estate Photographers Use?

Among the filters, polarizing filters. Polarizing filters are great for fixing unwanted reflections. Many photographers, including real estate photographers, use these filters. Along with real estate, the following filter is useful for other photographs as well. And you must use the filter as well. 

Conclusion

The best Nikon lens for real estate photography can make your job a lot easier. Because you get all the features which are helpful for your shoot. Plus, a good lens runs longer and gives proper protection from dirt and other elements.

So, you should check out all of the mentioned Nikon lenses and choose the best one for you. As a real estate photographer, it would help in every way. The results would be sharper and clean-looking photographs. This is why you should take steps to adapt to a perfect Nikon lens right now. 

Bordie Capron

Author

“Bordie Capron is a Sr. Content Maker who is working in The Clipping Path Service an US-based image and video post-production company for over 7+ years. She completed her degree in graphic designing and worked as a graphic designing expert for several years. She always loved writing”
